summary: Leiomyosarcoma (LMS) is a rare malignant smooth muscle tumor that can originate in various hollow organs made of smooth muscles, most commonly the uterus and abdomen. It is a type of soft-tissue sarcoma, representing 10-20% of new cases, and is more frequently diagnosed in adults. LMS are generally resistant to chemotherapy and radiation, with surgical removal at an early stage being the most effective treatment.
